primary_entry.label: Employees
primary_entry.purpose: Main entry point for this feature

discovery_instructions: Identify what the main item/entity is for this feature (e.g., employee record, document, invitation)
Look for list/table views - the rows represent the primary entity
Check page headers and breadcrumbs for entity naming
Note the singular and plural forms used in the UI

find_trigger: Look for buttons with: + Add, + Create, + New, plus icon
Check top-right corner of the page
Look in empty state messages for create prompts
create.validation: New item appears in list with unique identifier

find_trigger: Click on any row in a list/table
Look for 'View' or eye icon buttons
Check if rows are clickable (cursor changes)
read.validation: Detail panel, modal, or page opens showing full information

find_trigger: Look for Edit button, pencil icon
Check for inline editing (click on field to edit)
Look for status change dropdowns or buttons
Check action menus (three-dot menu) for edit option
update.validation: Changes persist after save, reflected in list view

find_trigger: Look for Delete button, trash icon
Check action menus (three-dot menu) for delete option
Look for bulk delete with checkboxes
Some features use 'Archive' or 'Cancel' instead of delete
delete.validation: Item removed from list or status changed to deleted/archived

instructions: Navigate to the feature's main section using the navigation_map
Take a full page snapshot to understand the layout
Find ALL clickable elements: buttons, links, tabs, dropdowns, icons
Map the navigation structure: tabs, sidebar items, breadcrumbs
Click each tab/sub-section and document what appears
Locate CRUD controls for the primary entity
Check for action menus (three-dot menus, right-click menus)
Document any modals, dialogs, slide-out panels
Identify form fields and input types when forms appear
Look for filters, search, sort, and export options
Check for bulk action controls (checkboxes, select all)
Note any settings or configuration options
discovery_targets: List/table of items with row actions

content_clusters.consolidation_notes: Three articles covering the complete employee invitation lifecycle: initial invitations, managing pending invites (resend/delete/search), and correcting incorrect email addresses. Consolidated into unified workflow covering both individual and bulk operations.
Articles covering company logo upload and career page setup. Both relate to company branding and external-facing company profile configuration.
Single article on document storage and tracking with expiry management. Critical for payroll compliance (trade license updates).

Office locations and organization chart viewing. PRD on Employee Records V2.1 enriches with improved employee list viewing (pagination, search, role/department columns) which supports organizational structure visibility.
Single article on company-wide announcements with draft/publish workflow.
Single article on bank account management for payroll processing.
Comprehensive article covering document management, role assignment, letter generation, and bank account setup with package-dependent features.

Articles on downloading employee data and updating custom fields merged with PRD on Employee Records V2.1 which enhances employee list viewing and search capabilities. PRD enriches article tasks with global search, pagination, and recently viewed features.

Four articles covering fitness data sync for Android (Google Fit) and iOS (Apple Health) platforms, plus troubleshooting guides for both. Consolidated into platform-specific sync tasks and cross-platform troubleshooting.
Single article covering third-party integration workaround for Huawei Health users to sync data via Health Sync intermediary app.
Article on updating critical employee documents required for Non-WPS Trade License payroll processing.
Grouped tickets addressing missing or inconsistent validation during data entry (Excel uploads, form fields, MOL ID). All affect data quality and user guidance.
Grouped tickets addressing missing fields in bulk upload templates (job type, employee roles). Both limit HR's ability to manage employee data at scale.
Grouped tickets addressing frontend rendering issues, inconsistent navigation, dropdown visibility, and dialog usability. All affect user experience during daily operations.

Grouped tickets addressing missing policy view functionality, leave record visibility after unassignment, leave balance adjustment capability, and hire date validation timing. All affect leave/policy workflows.
Single ticket addressing custom role configuration capability. Resolved as a how-to question; included for completeness but represents configuration guidance rather than a limitation.
Grouped tickets addressing missing streamlined employee search API and inability to dynamically embed CSM contact information in emails.
Grouped frontend state management issues affecting conditional visibility, navigation dialogs, and search functionality. All impact data retention and user interaction flow.
Consolidated document upload interface issues including error messaging clarity, missing delete functionality, OCR auto-reclassification, and redundant UI sections.
Consolidated document lifecycle issues including expiry reminder system architecture, PHP-to-Kotlin migration needs, and automatic relationship maintenance gaps.
Grouped missing field controls and validation constraints including hire date change restrictions, work email modification controls, contract type capture, and employee search functionality.
Consolidated document editing restrictions and employee status validation gaps affecting dependent documents and comment mentions.
Grouped employee listing discrepancies, missing information filters, and Excel export failures affecting administrative visibility and reporting.
Consolidated backend routing errors, architectural coupling issues, and platform flexibility constraints affecting employee records module.

articles.title: Letters & Company Docs
articles.q1_job_to_be_done: To provide a comprehensive platform for managing company documentation, roles, financial transactions, and official communications within an organization
articles.q3_key_actions_steps: 1. Assign roles to team members, 2. Manage company documents, 3. Generate official letters, 4. Set up company bank accounts, 5. Use analytical dashboards, 6. Track document renewals, 7. Process financial transactions
articles.q4_rules_limitations_constraints: 1. Analytical Dashboards are package-dependent, 2. Limited to selecting up to three names per dashboard, 3. Requires accurate information input, 4. Specific roles have defined access levels and responsibilities
articles.q7_edge_cases_warnings: 1. Ensure Analytical Dashboards are included in your package, 2. Verify feature is unticked if not available, 3. Use predefined templates for letter consistency
articles.q8_hierarchical_task_analysis:
1.0 Manage Company Documentation
    1.1 Assign Roles
        1.1.1 Select appropriate role
        1.1.2 Define access levels
    1.2 Upload Company Documents
        1.2.1 Collect required documents
        1.2.2 Verify document details
        1.2.3 Upload to centralized storage
    1.3 Generate Official Letters
        1.3.1 Select letter template
        1.3.2 Get Signatory approval
    1.4 Set Up Bank Account
        1.4.1 Gather bank details
        1.4.2 Input account information
articles.q9_feature_interactions: 1. HR Management system (employee profiles), 2. Payroll processing, 3. Expense management, 4. Financial transaction system, 5. Analytical dashboards for data visualization

articles.title: How can I download employee data from Bayzat?
articles.q1_job_to_be_done: To allow users to download a complete Excel file of all employee records for easy data management and insurance-related documentation
articles.q3_key_actions_steps: Navigate to Company > All Employees, click on the Download icon to export employee data as an Excel file
articles.q4_rules_limitations_constraints: Users should keep employee records as up-to-date as possible, especially for insurance renewal purposes
articles.q7_edge_cases_warnings: The downloaded Excel sheet can be directly used as a census sheet for group health insurance renewal
articles.q8_hierarchical_task_analysis:
1.0 Access Employee Records
    1.1 Navigate to Company section
    1.2 Select All Employees view
2.0 Download Employee Data
    2.1 Click Download icon
    2.2 Verify Excel file download
articles.q9_feature_interactions: Interacts with group health insurance renewal process by providing a ready-to-use census sheet of employee data

articles.title: Adding values or data to Custom field
articles.q1_job_to_be_done: To allow users to update and manage custom data fields for employees and companies within the Bayzat platform
articles.q3_key_actions_steps:
1. Mass upload data via Bayzat Sheets
2. Download and update sheets offline
3. Update individual employee profiles
4. Update company custom data fields
articles.q4_rules_limitations_constraints:
1. Overwritten data cannot be retrieved
2. Need to be careful when updating payroll-related custom fields
3. Requires careful backup and verification of data
articles.q7_edge_cases_warnings:
1. Overwritten data cannot be retrieved
2. Need to be careful when updating payroll-related custom fields
3. Requires careful backup and verification of data
articles.q8_hierarchical_task_analysis:
1.0 Update Custom Fields
    1.1 Choose update method
        1.1.1 Mass upload via Bayzat Sheets
        1.1.2 Individual profile update
    1.2 Select data type
        1.2.1 Employee custom data
        1.2.2 Company custom data
    1.3 Make necessary changes
    1.4 Save updates
    1.5 Verify data accuracy
articles.q9_feature_interactions:
1. Interacts with Employee Profiles
2. Connected to Payroll Templates
3. Integrated with Settings and Custom Data management sections

articles.title: Update necessary employee information for Non WPS Trade License
articles.q1_job_to_be_done: To help users update missing critical employee information required for processing payroll for Non WPS Trade License employees
articles.q3_key_actions_steps: 1. Go to Payroll Table, 2. Click on employee name, 3. Upload missing documents (Employee Passport or Emirates ID)
articles.q4_rules_limitations_constraints: Employees must have critical information uploaded to process payroll
articles.q7_edge_cases_warnings: Payroll processing is blocked until critical employee documents are uploaded
articles.q8_hierarchical_task_analysis:
1.0 Access Payroll Table
    1.1 Identify employees with missing information
2.0 Select Employee
    2.1 Click on employee name
3.0 Upload Documents
    3.1 Upload Employee Passport or Emirates ID
articles.q9_feature_interactions: Interacts with Payroll processing system and document management system

jira_tickets.title: Add role columns to Employee Export/Import excel
Employee and its reportsTo employee cannot be deleted simultaneously
Blank Emirates ID field gives improper error message
Error when importing already existing employees
Hire date change check across system modules
Disallow work email change if user is registered
Uploaded document type changes according to OCR

opportunity_assessment.title: Opportunity Assessment: Employee profile improvements
key_improvements: Admin photo upload capability on employee profile
Permission configuration for document, personal info, work info, and dependent data editing
Approval workflow for document changes and payment details
Customizable employee directory fields (Country of Residence, Manager)
Email notifications for approval requests with Arabic support
opportunity_assessment.addresses: 33 companies with manual restrictions, 44 Aha votes for edit permissions

product_context.title: PRD: Employee Records V2.1
product_context.why_built: Improve employee list management for companies with large workforces. Addresses need for HR Admins to view up to 500 employees at once (instead of 10), use global search accessible via CMD/CTRL+K from anywhere in the product, see recently viewed employees and recent searches for quick access, and view additional employee data points (role, department) directly in the list. Enhances efficiency for large-scale employee management.
key_design_decisions: Configurable rows per page (10/25/50/100/250/500) to control display density and accommodate different company sizes
Global search accessible from all product areas via CMD/CTRL+K keyboard shortcut
Recently viewed employees (up to 5) displayed before typing in search
Recent search terms (up to 5) shown for quick re-access
Employee list displays name, role, and department columns
Edit icon removed from employee table rows to streamline interface
Circle with initials retained for employee avatars for consistency
DOB date picker disables future dates to prevent invalid entries
UAE-specific fields (Residence Visa Location, Trade License, MOL No.) conditionally shown based on Legal Country of Residence
Recently viewed employees (max 5) and recent searches (max 5) displayed before typing for quick access
No results message with guidance when search returns empty
Sections hidden when recently viewed or recent searches are null

product_context.title: Opportunity Assessment: Employee profile improvements
product_context.why_built: Give HR administrators control over employee profile data integrity through three improvements: (1) Allow admins to upload employee profile photos when employees don't add them, addressing photo management gaps; (2) Configure permissions to restrict employee editing of documents, personal/work info, and dependent data - addressing issues with larger organizations where employees mess up sensitive data; (3) Customize employee directory fields to show relevant information like country of residence and manager for remote team collaboration. Addresses 33 companies with manual restrictions and 44 Aha votes for edit permissions.
key_design_decisions: Admin photo upload capability on employee profile (web and mobile)
Permission configuration interface for document, personal info, work info, and dependent permissions
Approval workflow system for document changes and payment details provides audit trail and control
Email notifications for approval requests with Arabic translation support
Directory customization allows selection of fields to display in employee directory
Country of Residence and Manager fields added to People section for remote team visibility
Separate approval flow for payment details (sensitive financial data)
Change request history tracking for audit and compliance purposes
Admin photo upload capability allows direct profile picture management without employee involvement
Permission configuration interface enables granular control over document, personal info, work info, and dependent data editing
Email notifications alert admins to change requests requiring approval
Support for both Mobile and Web platforms ensures consistent experience
Arabic language support for approval workflows and notifications

detected_integrations.description: Sends employee invitation emails with registration links, automatic reminder emails (3 reminders if not accepted within 3 days), and approval request notifications for document/payment changes
Handles employee registration process after invitation acceptance, manages user access to Bayzat platform

Letters & Company Docs feature integrates with Payroll processing system; Custom Fields interact with Payroll Templates; Employee information updates required for Non-WPS Trade License payroll processing
Uses office location configuration with geo-location and check-in radius for location-based employee check-ins
Organization chart navigation links to individual employee profiles; permission configuration controls employee editing of profile data; photo upload capability in admin profile view
Document lifecycle management lacks automatic relationship maintenance and dependent document controls across different document types and insurance policy stages.
Employee profile improvements use reusable approval workflow system for documents and payment details changes; includes email notifications
Tracks search bar clicks, keyboard shortcut usage (CMD/CTRL+K), and failed searches for employee records
Country-conditional fields (Residence Visa Location, Trade License, MOL No.) interact with visa and MOL modules for UAE employees
Chat feature for email change requests when employee has already registered and work email field is locked
Company Assets feature interacts with employee records page for populating employee names and linking assets to team members
Company Assets potentially links with financial tracking systems for depreciation calculations and asset valuation
Letters & Company Docs feature interacts with HR Management system for employee profiles and role assignment
Letters & Company Docs feature integrates with Expense management system for financial transaction tracking
Letters & Company Docs feature includes analytical dashboards for data visualization; package-dependent feature
Wellness Hub feature integrates with Google Fit for Android fitness data synchronization; requires Google account connection
Wellness Hub feature integrates with Apple Health for iOS fitness data synchronization; requires explicit user permissions
Third-party intermediary app used to sync Huawei Health data to Google Fit for Huawei wearable users
Employee profile improvements enable customizable field display in employee directory; supports Country of Residence and Manager fields
Employee profile improvements enhance People section with Country of Residence and Manager information for remote team collaboration
Custom Fields feature integrates with Settings and Custom Data management sections for employee and company data configuration
Leave records visibility and balance management affected by policy assignment/unassignment workflows. Hire date validation impacts leave page access.
Policy documents not viewable from employee profile. Policy assignment affects leave record persistence.
Goals section and employee profile table width affected by responsive design constraints.
Excel upload validation for payroll data and employee records. IBAN lookup for bank account identification.
Employee role configuration not supported in bulk uploads. Custom role creation for access control.
Transaction isolation issues preventing concurrent deletion of employee and reporting manager. Stale state exceptions during updates.
OCR automatically reclassifies document types without user confirmation, impacting document management workflows and downstream processes like endorsements.
Platform lacks dedicated employee search endpoint with comprehensive search and dropdown capabilities, affecting employee record retrieval across multiple workflows.
Backend routing and authentication constraints prevent smooth navigation between employee record pages, causing 404 errors in employee management interface.
Technical constraint preventing successful Excel file generation and download in View Team Page, impacting data export and reporting capabilities.
Mixed PHP and Kotlin architecture complicates implementing consistent restrictions and validation for hire date modifications and document expiry reminders across modules.

check_instructions: Navigate to Automations in the left sidebar
Click + Create workflow (or similar create button)
In trigger selection, search for this feature's name
Check if this feature appears as a trigger source
Document any trigger events found (e.g., 'item created', 'status changed')
Check Actions section for actions related to this feature
Look for 'Approval' or 'Pending Approval' status in the feature
Check if items have approval workflow indicators
Look for 'Submit for Approval' buttons or actions
Find approval settings in feature configuration
Document the approval chain (who approves what)
Test approval/rejection flow if test data available
Check for approval history or audit trail

steps: Navigate to Company > All Employees
Click 'Send Invite' button
Choose invitation method: Individual (click invite button next to employee) OR Bulk (select multiple employees via checkbox)
Confirm employee details are correct
Send invitation via email
Verify invitation sent successfully
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Employee receives email invitation with registration link. Invitation expires in 3 days. Employee can register and gain access to Bayzat platform.
rules_and_constraints: Must provide a valid work email (or personal email in work email field)
Invitation expires in 3 days
Email field is mandatory for invitation
Bayzat automatically sends 3 email reminders if employee hasn't accepted initial invitation
edge_cases: If employee does not register within 3 days, invite must be resent
Bulk invitations can be sent to multiple employees at once

source_articles.title: How to invite employees to Bayzat

what_to_do.task: Manage pending employee invitations (resend, delete, search, correct email)
steps: Navigate to Company > Invitations page
Search for invited employees by name or email (optional)
To resend: Click purple 'Resend' button for individual invite OR click 'Resend All' button for all pending invites
To delete: Click dustbin icon next to the invite
To correct wrong email: Delete the existing incorrect invite, navigate to employee's Personal tab, edit Contact section to update work email, then resend invite from All Employees tab
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Pending invitations are managed efficiently. Corrected invitations are sent to the right email address. Deleted invitations are removed from the system.
rules_and_constraints: Invite can only be modified if the employee has not yet registered on Bayzat
If employee has already registered, work email field is greyed out and cannot be changed directly by administrator
Bayzat automatically sends 3 email reminders if employee hasn't accepted initial invitation
Search functionality filters by employee name or email
edge_cases: If wrong email was used initially, admin must delete invite and update employee email before resending
If employee has already registered, contact Customer Support via chat feature for email changes
Resend All button sends reminders to all pending invitations at once

source_articles.title: How to resend, delete and search employee invites?
How to resend an invite sent to the wrong employee email ID?

what_to_do.task: Configure company branding (logo and career page)
steps: Navigate to Settings menu
Click on Company settings
Select 'Company Logo' section
Click 'Change logo'
Upload logo file
Save changes
For career page: Set up company brand, define company locations and departments, choose page builder method (site builder or APIs), and publish job openings
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Company logo is displayed on Bayzat platform interface and employee payslips. Career page is configured with company branding and job openings visible to external candidates.
rules_and_constraints: Logo upload is available in Company settings
Career page setup requires configuration of company locations and departments
edge_cases: Logo will appear on payslip generation and end-of-service settlement documents

source_articles.title: How to add your company logo to Bayzat
Brand & career page

what_to_do.task: Upload and manage company documents with expiry tracking
steps: Navigate to Company > Company Documents
Click 'Upload document'
Select document file
Choose document type
Enter document details: Name, Description, and Expiry date
Save document
To manage: Edit, replace, delete, or download documents as needed
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Company documents are centrally stored with expiry date tracking. Admins can monitor document status and ensure timely updates (especially trade licenses) to prevent payroll processing issues.
rules_and_constraints: Users can upload multiple trade license documents
Must update expired trade license documents to ensure smooth payroll processing
Document type selection is mandatory
Expiry date tracking is available for all documents
edge_cases: Users must ensure trade license documents are updated to prevent payroll processing issues
Multiple trade licenses can be stored for different business entities

source_articles.title: Storing and tracking your company documents

what_to_do.task: Create and manage multiple office locations
steps: Navigate to Settings > Company tab
Expand Offices section
Click 'Add New'
Enter Office Name
Enter Office Location (geo-location auto-filled)
Optionally adjust Attendance check-in radius
Save Office Location
To manage: Edit or delete existing office locations as needed
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Multiple office locations are configured in the system. Employees can check in at their assigned office location within the configured radius. Attendance tracking is location-aware.
rules_and_constraints: Attendance check-in is limited by a configurable radius (e.g., 100 meters from office location)
Geo-location is automatically filled in when creating an office
Check-in radius can be adjusted per office location
edge_cases: Users can adjust check-in radius for attendance tracking to allow employees to check in within a specific distance from the office

source_articles.title: Creating multiple office locations for your company

what_to_do.task: View and navigate organization structure and employee hierarchy
what_to_do.persona: HR Admin | Super Admin | People Manager | Employee
steps: Determine user role: Super Admin accesses Company > All Employees; Employees access People tab
Click Organization chart view button
View organizational chart with departments, employees, job titles, and reporting relationships
Expand or collapse organizational nodes using arrows: Top arrow (view/hide reporting managers), Side arrows (view/hide employees at same level), Bottom arrow (view/hide reporting employees)
Click on employee names to view their detailed profiles
Use 'How it Works' text to understand chart generation
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Users can visualize the complete organizational structure with clear reporting relationships. Employees understand their place in the hierarchy and can access colleague profiles.
rules_and_constraints: Organization chart will only be displayed if at least one employee has 'Reports to' field filled out
Chart generation is based on 'Reports to' field data in employee records
Super Admins access via Company > All Employees; other users via People tab
edge_cases: If no employees have a 'Reports to' field filled out, the organization chart will not be displayed
Employees with no reporting manager appear at the top level of the chart

source_articles.title: How to access Organization structure

steps: Click on 'Announcements' under Company menu
Click 'Create Announcement'
Compose message with text
Optionally add images and attachments
Choose action: Publish immediately OR Save as draft
If saved as draft: Preview, Edit, Publish, or Delete as needed
View announcement details after publishing
Delete announcements if needed (Super Admins and People Managers only)
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Company-wide announcements are created and published to all employees on the Bayzat app. Drafts allow for review before publishing. Published announcements can be managed (viewed or deleted).
rules_and_constraints: Only Super Admins and People Managers can create and send announcements
Announcements can only be created on the web, not mobile app
Announcements can be saved as drafts for later publishing
Published announcements can be deleted by Super Admins and People Managers
edge_cases: Announcements can be saved as drafts and previewed before publishing
Drafts can be edited or deleted before publishing
Images and attachments are optional

source_articles.title: Company Announcement

what_to_do.task: Configure company bank accounts for payroll
what_to_do.persona: HR Admin | Super Admin | Finance Manager
steps: Navigate to Settings > Payroll section
Expand Bank Accounts section
Click 'Add New'
Enter bank account details (account number, bank name, IBAN, etc.)
Select associated Trade License (if multiple licenses exist)
Save account details
To manage: Edit account details if needed
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Company bank accounts are configured for payroll processing. Multiple bank accounts can be stored and linked to appropriate trade licenses. Salary payments are processed to the configured accounts.
rules_and_constraints: If multiple Trade Licenses exist, users must select the appropriate license when adding a bank account
Multiple bank accounts can be added if needed
Bank account details are required for payroll processing
edge_cases: Multiple bank accounts can be configured for different trade licenses or business entities

source_articles.title: How to update your company bank details

what_to_do.task: Configure employee profile permissions and approval workflows
steps: Access configuration settings for employee profile permissions
Configure document permissions: Set whether employees can add, edit, or delete documents
Configure personal information permissions: Set whether employees can edit personal/work info
Configure dependent permissions: Set whether employees can edit dependent documents and information
Configure approval workflow: Set up document approval workflow for sensitive changes
Configure payment details approval: Set up separate approval flow for payment details changes
Customize employee directory fields: Select which fields to display (e.g., Country of Residence, Manager)
Enable directory customization in People section and employee directory portal
what_to_do.expected_outcome: HR admins have granular control over employee profile data integrity. Sensitive changes (documents, personal info, payment details) require approval. Employee directory displays relevant information for remote team collaboration.
rules_and_constraints: Permission configuration applies organization-wide
Approval workflows required for document and payment details changes when restrictions enabled
Email notifications sent for approval requests
Support for both Mobile and Web platforms
Arabic translation required for approval notifications
Currently 33 companies have manual restrictions (17 for documents, 9 for personal/work info, 7 for dependent info)
edge_cases: What if employee needs urgent document update - Emergency bypass option may be needed
What about existing documents when restrictions enabled - Grandfathering strategy needed
What if approver is unavailable - Backup approver or escalation process needed
What about profile photos that don't meet standards - Admin override with guidelines needed
What if employee reports to multiple managers - Clarify which manager shown in directory
What about employees in transition (changing roles) - Temporary edit permissions may be needed
Bulk photo uploads may be needed for admin efficiency

steps: Select an employee from the dropdown list
Input asset serial number
Specify asset type, brand, and model
Set asset status (Working, Damaged, or In-repair)
Record purchase date
Note asset assignment date
Specify office location
Save asset record
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Asset is recorded in the system with complete details including employee assignment, condition status, and location. Asset can be tracked for maintenance needs and accountability purposes.
rules_and_constraints: Mandatory fields: employee name, serial number, asset type, brand, model
Asset status must be selected from predefined options: Working, Damaged, or In-repair
Each asset must be assigned to a specific employee
Office location must be specified for tracking purposes
edge_cases: Assets can transition between states (working → damaged → in-repair) to track maintenance needs
Multiple assets can be assigned to the same employee
Asset status changes should be documented for maintenance tracking

source_articles.title: Company Assets

what_to_do.task: Manage Company Documentation, Roles, and Financial Setup
steps: Assign appropriate roles to team members and define access levels
Collect and verify required company documents
Upload company documents to centralized storage
Select letter template for official communications
Obtain signatory approval for generated letters
Gather bank account details
Input company bank account information
Configure analytical dashboards if included in package
Track document renewal dates
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Company documentation is centrally managed, roles are properly assigned with defined access levels, official letters can be generated with appropriate approvals, bank accounts are configured, and analytical dashboards are available for data visualization.
rules_and_constraints: Analytical Dashboards are package-dependent; verify feature is enabled
Limited to selecting up to three names per dashboard
Specific roles have defined access levels and responsibilities
Requires accurate information input for all company details
Letter generation requires signatory approval before issuance
Bank account setup requires complete and verified account information
edge_cases: Analytical Dashboards may not be available in all packages
Use predefined templates for letter consistency and compliance
Document renewal tracking prevents compliance gaps
Multiple signatories may be required for certain letter types

source_articles.title: Letters & Company Docs

steps: Navigate to Company section
Select All Employees view
Click the Download icon
Verify Excel file download completes
Review downloaded employee data for accuracy
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Complete Excel file of all employee records is downloaded and ready for use. File can be used directly as a census sheet for group health insurance renewal or other HR documentation purposes.
rules_and_constraints: Users should keep employee records as up-to-date as possible before export
Downloaded file is in Excel format for compatibility with insurance systems
Export includes all active employee records in the system
edge_cases: Downloaded Excel sheet can be directly used as a census sheet for group health insurance renewal
Large employee datasets may take longer to download
Employee records should be current to ensure insurance documentation accuracy

source_articles.title: How can I download employee data from Bayzat?

what_to_do.task: View and Search Employee Records with Enhanced List Management
steps: Navigate to Employees section (renamed from 'View team')
Select rows per page (10/25/50/100/250/500) to control display density
View employee list with name, role, and department columns
Press CMD/CTRL+K from anywhere to open global search
View recently viewed employees (up to 5) before typing
View recent search terms (up to 5) and click to pre-fill search
Type employee name to search and see matching results
Click employee to navigate to their profile
what_to_do.expected_outcome: HR Admin can efficiently manage large employee lists (up to 500 employees per page), quickly locate employees using global search accessible from anywhere in the product, and access recently viewed profiles and search history for faster navigation.
rules_and_constraints: Maximum 500 employees displayed per page
Recently viewed shows maximum 5 profiles
Recent searches shows maximum 5 search terms
If recently viewed or recent searches are null, those sections are hidden
Edit icon removed from employee table rows
Circle with initials retained for employee avatars
UAE-specific fields (Residence Visa Location, Trade License, MOL No.) only shown when Legal Country of Residence is UAE
edge_cases: Search returns no results - display specific message with guidance
Recently viewed is empty - hide section
Recent searches is empty - hide section
Very large company approaching 500+ employees per page load performance
Employee deleted between search and click
Search characters that match no employees
Non-UAE employee with residency fields visible

what_to_do.task: Update Custom Fields for Employees and Companies
steps: Choose update method: mass upload via Bayzat Sheets or individual profile update
Download backup of current data before making changes
Select data type: employee custom data or company custom data
Make necessary changes to custom field values
Verify data accuracy before saving
Save updates to the system
Confirm custom company data is updated if mapped to payroll templates
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Custom fields for employees and companies are updated with accurate data. Changes are saved and reflected across the system, including payroll templates if applicable.
rules_and_constraints: Must download a backup before making changes
Previous records will be overwritten - no undo available
Ensure custom company data is updated if mapped to payroll templates
Overwritten data cannot be retrieved
Need to be careful when updating payroll-related custom fields
Requires careful backup and verification of data
edge_cases: Overwritten data cannot be retrieved - backup is essential
Payroll-related custom fields require extra verification
Mass upload via Bayzat Sheets allows offline updates
Individual profile updates for single-record changes

source_articles.title: Adding values or data to Custom field

what_to_do.task: Sync Fitness Data with Bayzat App (Android & iOS)
steps: For Android: Download Google Fit app and login with Google account; For iOS: Ensure Apple Health app is installed
Ensure fitness data is being recorded in the respective health app
Open Wellness Hub in Bayzat app
Click 'Connect Bayzat with Google Fit' (Android) or 'Connect Bayzat with Health app' (iOS)
For Android: Choose the same Google account used in Google Fit
For iOS: Confirm permission to share data and select specific health data types
For iOS: Ensure all data sliders are turned green in Apple Health settings
Verify data appears in Bayzat app Wellness Hub
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Fitness data from Google Fit (Android) or Apple Health (iOS) is successfully synced to Bayzat app. Employee can view their wellness information in the Wellness Hub.
rules_and_constraints: Android: Must use Google Fit as the data source
Android: Must have fitness data already in Google Fit
Android: Must use the same Google account across both apps
Android: Must manually open Wellness Hub to initiate data exchange
iOS: Must use Apple Health app
iOS: Must open Wellness Hub to initiate data exchange
iOS: Requires user permission to share health data
Both: Bayzat does not directly connect to wearable devices
Both: Users must manually open Wellness Hub to trigger data sync
edge_cases: Bayzat does not directly connect to wearable devices - must use health app intermediary
Users can use any device (fitness band, smartwatch, or smartphone) as long as it's connected to Apple Health (iOS)
Data sync requires manual opening of Wellness Hub to trigger
Only works with devices that can connect to Google Fit (Android) or Apple Health (iOS)

source_articles.title: How to sync fitness data with Bayzat app [Android]
How to sync fitness data with Bayzat app [iOS]

what_to_do.task: Troubleshoot Fitness Data Sync Issues (Android & iOS)
steps: For Android: Check Google Fit app to ensure activity is being recorded; For iOS: Check Apple Health app to ensure activity is being recorded
For Android: Remove Bayzat app from connected apps in Google Fit settings
For iOS: Verify Bayzat permissions in Health app settings
For iOS: Turn off all data access permissions for Bayzat
Close and restart Bayzat app
For Android: Reconnect Google Fit in Wellness Hub
For iOS: Turn on all data access permissions for Bayzat
Verify data sync is working
If issues persist: Uninstall and reinstall Bayzat app from app store
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Data synchronization between health apps and Bayzat is restored. Fitness data flows correctly from Google Fit (Android) or Apple Health (iOS) to Bayzat Wellness Hub.
rules_and_constraints: Android: Must use the same Google account for both Google Fit and Bayzat app reconnection
iOS: Users must provide explicit permissions for Bayzat to read data from Apple Health app
Both: Data might not sync if required permissions are not granted or configured correctly
edge_cases: If initial troubleshooting steps fail, complete app deletion and reinstallation is recommended
Permission issues are the most common cause of sync failures
App reinstallation should be last resort after permission resets

source_articles.title: Data sync troubleshooting [iOS]
Data sync troubleshooting [Android]

what_to_do.task: Sync Huawei Health Data to Bayzat via Google Fit
steps: Download Google Fit app from Play Store
Connect Google Fit to Bayzat app (follow standard Google Fit sync process)
Download Health Sync app from App Gallery Store
Open Health Sync app
Set up Health Sync with your Huawei Health account
Configure sync direction from Huawei Health to Google Fit
Verify data synchronization between Huawei Health and Google Fit
Confirm fitness data appears in Bayzat Wellness Hub
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Huawei Health data is synced to Google Fit via Health Sync intermediary app, and then flows to Bayzat app. Employee can view Huawei wearable fitness data in Bayzat Wellness Hub.
rules_and_constraints: Google Fit no longer directly supports Huawei Health data syncing
Requires using a third-party app (Health Sync) as intermediary
Only steps, distance, and workout data can be synced
Bayzat cannot guarantee 100% accurate data sync through multiple apps
edge_cases: Data may get lost during transfer between multiple apps
Only specific types of health data can be synced (steps, distance, workouts)
Requires two-step sync process: Huawei Health → Google Fit → Bayzat
Data accuracy may be affected by multiple app transfers

source_articles.title: How to link data from Huawei Health to Google Fit? [Android]

what_to_do.task: Update Critical Employee Information for Payroll Processing
steps: Navigate to Payroll Table
Identify employees with missing critical information (indicated by incomplete status)
Click on employee name to open their profile
Upload missing documents: Employee Passport or Emirates ID
Verify document upload is successful
Confirm employee record is now complete for payroll processing
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Critical employee documents are uploaded and employee records are complete. Payroll processing can proceed for Non-WPS Trade License employees.
rules_and_constraints: Employees must have critical information uploaded to process payroll
Payroll processing is blocked until critical employee documents are uploaded
Required documents: Employee Passport or Emirates ID
Applies specifically to Non-WPS Trade License employees
edge_cases: Payroll processing is blocked until documents are uploaded - creates urgent workflow
Multiple employees may have missing documents requiring batch updates
Document upload must be completed before payroll run

source_articles.title: Update necessary employee information for Non WPS Trade License

what_to_do.task: Configure Employee Profile Permissions and Data Integrity Controls
steps: Navigate to employee profile configuration settings
Upload or change employee profile picture directly (admin photo upload capability)
Access permission configuration interface
Set document permissions: configure whether employees can add/edit/delete documents
Set personal information permissions: configure whether employees can edit personal/work info
Set dependent information permissions: configure whether employees can edit dependent documents/info
Configure document approval workflow for change requests
Configure payment details approval workflow for sensitive financial data changes
Test approval notification system
Customize employee directory fields to display relevant information
Add Country of Residence field to People section (if applicable)
Add Manager field to People section (if applicable)
Enable Arabic language support for approval workflows and notifications
what_to_do.expected_outcome: HR Admin has full control over employee profile data integrity. Employees can only edit permitted fields, sensitive changes require approval, profile photos are managed by admin, and employee directory displays customized relevant information.
rules_and_constraints: Currently 33 companies have manual restrictions (17 for documents, 9 for personal/work info, 7 for dependent info)
Solution requires approval workflow configuration capability
Email notifications needed for approval requests
Must support both Mobile and Web platforms
Arabic translation required for all approval workflows
Approval flows needed for both documents and payment details
System tracks history of changes to inform admins of modifications made
edge_cases: What if employee needs urgent document update - Emergency bypass option may be needed
What about existing documents when restrictions enabled - Grandfathered or locked
What if approver is unavailable - Backup approver or escalation needed
What about profile photos that don't meet standards - Admin can override but guidelines needed
What if employee reports to multiple managers - Which shown in directory
What about employees in transition (changing roles) - Temporary edit permissions
How long to retain change request history - Audit requirements
What about bulk photo uploads - Admin efficiency feature

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Insufficient Data Validation During Entry & Upload
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks comprehensive validation checks during data entry and Excel uploads. Users can submit incomplete or invalid data (blank account numbers, MoL IDs, Emirates ID) without clear error messages. Validation for some fields (MOL ID) only triggers after specific user interactions, creating inconsistent validation behavior.
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The platform lacks comprehensive validation checks during data entry and Excel uploads. Users can submit incomplete or invalid data (blank account numbers, MoL IDs, Emirates ID) without clear error messages. Validation for some fields (MOL ID) only triggers after specific user interactions, creating inconsistent validation behavior.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Incomplete Employee Profile Data Fields & Missing Lookup Tools
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The employee profile lacks several important data fields and lookup capabilities. The city dropdown for Saudi Arabia is incomplete, missing important regional cities. The platform lacks a dedicated job title field, forcing users to repurpose the 'Title' field. There is no automated IBAN lookup tool to identify which employee profile is linked to a specific bank account, requiring manual investigation.
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The employee profile lacks several important data fields and lookup capabilities. The city dropdown for Saudi Arabia is incomplete, missing important regional cities. The platform lacks a dedicated job title field, forcing users to repurpose the 'Title' field. There is no automated IBAN lookup tool to identify which employee profile is linked to a specific bank account, requiring manual investigation.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The bulk upload template for employee records does not support all critical employee attributes. Job type/employment type configuration is not available in bulk uploads, requiring manual entry for each employee. Employee role management (Role 1, Role 2, Role 3, etc.) cannot be configured through Excel imports, limiting HR's ability to manage complex role structures at scale.
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The bulk upload template for employee records does not support all critical employee attributes. Job type/employment type configuration is not available in bulk uploads, requiring manual entry for each employee. Employee role management (Role 1, Role 2, Role 3, etc.) cannot be configured through Excel imports, limiting HR's ability to manage complex role structures at scale.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform exhibits multiple frontend rendering and navigation issues. The health insurance policy dropdown becomes non-visible after creating the first employee. Document import paging fails when deleting files, particularly on the last page. Employee name links work inconsistently across contexts (visible in comments but not in transaction submission). The data conflict dialog lacks a close button, restricting user control. Performance Management module has responsive design constraints affecting table width across screen sizes. Translation rendering issues exist in the older Ember frontend (now obsolete post-React migration).
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The platform exhibits multiple frontend rendering and navigation issues. The health insurance policy dropdown becomes non-visible after creating the first employee. Document import paging fails when deleting files, particularly on the last page. Employee name links work inconsistently across contexts (visible in comments but not in transaction submission). The data conflict dialog lacks a close button, restricting user control. Performance Management module has responsive design constraints affecting table width across screen sizes. Translation rendering issues exist in the older Ember frontend (now obsolete post-React migration).

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The leave and policy management workflows have several capability gaps. There is no view dialog or mechanism to display policy documents within the employee profile. Leave records become invisible after an employee is unassigned from a policy, creating inconsistent data visibility. The system cannot manually adjust leave balances to support negative balance scenarios, preventing HR from handling complex leave situations. Hire date validation is enforced at the wrong interaction stage, preventing page access instead of allowing page view with deferred validation for specific actions.
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The leave and policy management workflows have several capability gaps. There is no view dialog or mechanism to display policy documents within the employee profile. Leave records become invisible after an employee is unassigned from a policy, creating inconsistent data visibility. The system cannot manually adjust leave balances to support negative balance scenarios, preventing HR from handling complex leave situations. Hire date validation is enforced at the wrong interaction stage, preventing page access instead of allowing page view with deferred validation for specific actions.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform is constrained by officially recognized government locations and cannot accommodate project-based or emerging urban destinations that lack official city status. This prevents organizations from adding new cities or work locations that are not yet formally recognized by government authorities.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: Platform enforces compliance with official government location registries to maintain data accuracy and regulatory alignment.
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The platform is constrained by officially recognized government locations and cannot accommodate project-based or emerging urban destinations that lack official city status. This prevents organizations from adding new cities or work locations that are not yet formally recognized by government authorities.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform cannot simultaneously delete an employee and their reporting manager due to transaction isolation and data update conflicts. Concurrent deletion attempts trigger Hibernate's stale state exception, preventing transaction merging and blocking the deletion operation.
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The platform cannot simultaneously delete an employee and their reporting manager due to transaction isolation and data update conflicts. Concurrent deletion attempts trigger Hibernate's stale state exception, preventing transaction merging and blocking the deletion operation.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks streamlined backend APIs for efficient data access and email integration. There is no dedicated employee search API that provides minimal, role-based employee information for quick selection interfaces, limiting frontend efficiency and granular data access control. The platform cannot dynamically embed CSM contact information into welcome emails, with uncertainty about the precise data retrieval method (Salesforce vs. internal database).
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The platform lacks streamlined backend APIs for efficient data access and email integration. There is no dedicated employee search API that provides minimal, role-based employee information for quick selection interfaces, limiting frontend efficiency and granular data access control. The platform cannot dynamically embed CSM contact information into welcome emails, with uncertainty about the precise data retrieval method (Salesforce vs. internal database).

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform has inconsistent frontend state management for conditionally visible fields and navigation interactions. When fields become invisible, their data is lost and requires page refresh to restore. Additionally, navigating to the Employee Work tab unexpectedly triggers data change dialogs, and the Legal Country of Residence searchbox does not function correctly, preventing users from effectively searching or selecting values.
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The platform has inconsistent frontend state management for conditionally visible fields and navigation interactions. When fields become invisible, their data is lost and requires page refresh to restore. Additionally, navigating to the Employee Work tab unexpectedly triggers data change dialogs, and the Legal Country of Residence searchbox does not function correctly, preventing users from effectively searching or selecting values.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The document upload interface has multiple usability gaps: error messages for the 5MB file size limit lack clarity and user-friendly guidance; there is no delete or remove functionality for mistakenly uploaded files, forcing users to keep unwanted documents; the OCR system automatically reclassifies document types without explicit user confirmation, potentially misclassifying documents; and the employee profile interface contains redundant or multiple document upload sections and unnecessary dropzone areas that create visual complexity and user confusion.
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The document upload interface has multiple usability gaps: error messages for the 5MB file size limit lack clarity and user-friendly guidance; there is no delete or remove functionality for mistakenly uploaded files, forcing users to keep unwanted documents; the OCR system automatically reclassifies document types without explicit user confirmation, potentially misclassifying documents; and the employee profile interface contains redundant or multiple document upload sections and unnecessary dropzone areas that create visual complexity and user confusion.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The data import process lacks robust validation and conflict resolution mechanisms. The platform does not prevent users from inadvertently duplicating employee IDs through copy-paste actions during Excel imports, and there is no clear, user-friendly way to handle potential data discrepancies when assigning documents to employees with conflicting personal information.
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The data import process lacks robust validation and conflict resolution mechanisms. The platform does not prevent users from inadvertently duplicating employee IDs through copy-paste actions during Excel imports, and there is no clear, user-friendly way to handle potential data discrepancies when assigning documents to employees with conflicting personal information.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The document lifecycle management system has architectural and functional limitations. The document expiry reminder system is currently implemented in PHP with constraints that prevent efficient maintenance and scalability, requiring migration to Kotlin. Additionally, the document management system lacks automatic relationship maintenance when documents are replaced or edited, forcing users to manually re-establish document links after changes.
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The document lifecycle management system has architectural and functional limitations. The document expiry reminder system is currently implemented in PHP with constraints that prevent efficient maintenance and scalability, requiring migration to Kotlin. Additionally, the document management system lacks automatic relationship maintenance when documents are replaced or edited, forcing users to manually re-establish document links after changes.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The employee records system lacks comprehensive controls and field capture capabilities. The platform does not restrict hire date changes across different system modules due to mixed architecture (PHP and Kotlin) complexity; allows work email changes for registered users, compromising data consistency and verification processes; lacks a standardized way to capture and display contract type information in employee work profiles; and does not provide a dedicated employee search endpoint with comprehensive search and dropdown capabilities.
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The employee records system lacks comprehensive controls and field capture capabilities. The platform does not restrict hire date changes across different system modules due to mixed architecture (PHP and Kotlin) complexity; allows work email changes for registered users, compromising data consistency and verification processes; lacks a standardized way to capture and display contract type information in employee work profiles; and does not provide a dedicated employee search endpoint with comprehensive search and dropdown capabilities.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks nuanced controls for dependent documents and employee status validation. There is no mechanism to dynamically restrict document modifications based on insurance policy stage or administrative preferences across different document types, and the system allows mentioning inactive or off-boarded employees in comments, creating potential confusion and inappropriate interaction scenarios.
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The platform lacks nuanced controls for dependent documents and employee status validation. There is no mechanism to dynamically restrict document modifications based on insurance policy stage or administrative preferences across different document types, and the system allows mentioning inactive or off-boarded employees in comments, creating potential confusion and inappropriate interaction scenarios.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The employee records interface has filtering and reporting limitations. The employee assignment workflow lacks a clear sorting mechanism that prioritizes unassigned employees, creating confusion during data entry; the filtering mechanism restricts results based on profile completion status, preventing users from seeing a full list of employees with missing documentation; and the platform has a technical constraint preventing successful Excel file generation and download in the View Team Page, impacting users' ability to export and analyze team data.
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The employee records interface has filtering and reporting limitations. The employee assignment workflow lacks a clear sorting mechanism that prioritizes unassigned employees, creating confusion during data entry; the filtering mechanism restricts results based on profile completion status, preventing users from seeing a full list of employees with missing documentation; and the platform has a technical constraint preventing successful Excel file generation and download in the View Team Page, impacting users' ability to export and analyze team data.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The backend system has architectural and routing limitations affecting employee records functionality. The backend has routing and authentication constraints that prevent smooth navigation between employee record pages, resulting in unexpected 404 errors across different sections of the employee management interface. Additionally, the platform has architectural complexity with HR-related classes tightly coupled in the core module, and the Employee Records module lacks flexibility in data point tracking and table configuration to accommodate custom data tracking requirements.
what_to_watch_out_for.description: The backend system has architectural and routing limitations affecting employee records functionality. The backend has routing and authentication constraints that prevent smooth navigation between employee record pages, resulting in unexpected 404 errors across different sections of the employee management interface. Additionally, the platform has architectural complexity with HR-related classes tightly coupled in the core module, and the Employee Records module lacks flexibility in data point tracking and table configuration to accommodate custom data tracking requirements.

gaps_identified: People Manager has limited task coverage (2 tasks) - primarily announcement creation and org chart viewing
Employee persona has minimal coverage (1 task) - only org chart viewing; no self-service profile or document management tasks in this batch

Finance Manager: No tasks identified in this batch. Finance Manager would benefit from tasks related to payroll processing, financial reporting, and asset depreciation calculations if those features were documented.
Employee persona has minimal coverage (1 issue). Most limitations affect HR Admin workflows.
Finance Manager coverage limited to validation issues. No payroll-specific limitations documented in this batch.
Finance Manager has zero reported issues in Records Management feature

execution_order: 2. EXPLORATION - Navigate to feature, discover all UI elements using exploration_phase instructions
3. IDENTIFY ENTITY - Determine the primary item/entity using primary_entity discovery
4. CRUD TEST - Test create, read, update, delete for the primary entity
5. WORKFLOW CHECK - Verify if feature has workflow triggers/actions
6. APPROVAL FLOW - Test approval process if present
7. WHAT_TO_DO - Execute each task from what_to_do array, validate expected outcomes
8. WHAT_TO_WATCH_OUT_FOR - Validate known limitations and edge cases
9. DOCUMENTATION - Capture screenshots of every significant state change
10. REPORT - Generate validation report with pass/fail for each task and issue
